articles.content: JR East said a failure to â€restore power after overnight maintenance work at Tokyo's Tamachi Station left both lines without electricity â€‹early Friday. A spokesperson said smoke â€Œwas seen coming from a track-side equipment box near the station. Passengers were seen disembarking from a Keihin-Tohoku train stranded between stations and walking along the tracks to â evacuate, assisted by firefighters â€‹and railway staff. Images â€‹on social media showed commuters packing busy stations. The Yamanote Line passes â€through stations â including Shinjuku, which handles about 3.5 million passengers daily.
